metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25687 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in dnsmasq before version 2.83. A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in dnsmasq when DNSSEC is enabled and before it validates the received DNS entries. This flaw allows a remote attacker, who can create valid DNS replies, to cause an overflow in a heap-allocated memory. This flaw is caused by the lack of length checks in rfc1035.c:extract_name(), which could be abused to make the code execute memcpy() with a negative size in sort_rrset() and cause a crash in dnsmasq, resulting in a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-25687` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dnsmasq - 2.82-1ubuntu2
dnsmasq-base - 2.82-1ubuntu2
dnsmasq-base-lua - 2.82-1ubuntu2
dnsmasq-utils - 2.82-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dnsmasq package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.82-1ubuntu2').
